attributes.action: Allow customers access to cardboard boxes in supermarkets and shops
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
With the current aversion to the use of plastic carriers issued by supermarkets and shops, allow these establishments to leave out empty cardboard cartons and boxes for the use of their customers to transport purchases.
This was the practice until a few years ago when shops were stopped from doing so in the interests of recycling.
To allow it again would automatically reduce the numbers of plastic carriers used and the boxes could be recyled by the customer.
As the majority of people visit supermarkets by car, boxes are a much  more suitable method of transporting purchases than plastic carriers and are far easier to dispose of responsibly.
